evidence.text: consent  decrees  create  the  material  alteration  of  the  legal  relationship  of  the  parties  necessary to permit an award of attorney’s fees.
a court-ordered consent decree is consistent with the rule announced here.  While the decree reflects the parties’ own resolution of the merits, it is approved and given force of law by a court.

the alteration of the parties’ legal relationship must be a judicial act, not the voluntary conduct of the parties or a third party.  And following Farrar, it instructs that the judicial act needs to be akin to “a judgment on the merits or a court-ordered consent decree.”
